One of the most significant long-term benefits of rent control is its ability to preserve affordable housing stock. In rapidly gentrifying neighborhoods, rising market rents can push out long-time residents, including seniors, working families, and small businesses. When combined with inclusionary zoning and other complementary policies, rent control becomes part of a broader strategy to ensure that housing supply meets the needs of all residents, not just the highest bidders.
